document_data.name: Arrowroot
document_data.mainbody: '''Arrowroot''', known as '''nduma''' in the [[Chultan language]], was a starchy plant found in [[Chult]].

Ecology.Uses:
Arrowroot was used as bait by [[hunter]]s in Chult to lure great [[ape]]s.

In [[alchemy]], arrowroot (as well as [[carrot]], [[jimsonweed]], and [[sesame]]) was a key ingredient in powders designed to provide the user with night vision (comparable to that of a [[cat]]).{{Cite dragon/130/Better Living Through Alchemy|39}} Arrowroot was also used to make [[cosmetic]]s, namely [[eyeshadow]], such as was favored by [[Nerys Kathon]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].

document_data.History: In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], particularly enormous arrowroots could sell for more than 4 [[silver pieces]] in [[Port Nyanzaru]]. At that time, the hunter [[Desha|Desha of the Shadows]] devised a plan to use such a giant arrowroot as a lure to hunt a massive ape known as [[Gigantopithecus]], which was said to dwell in the lost city of [[Omu]] deep within the Chultan jungle.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: It was said that among some [[Monastic order|monastic traditions]], arrowroot represented the power of healing, and some [[monk]]s were said to have [[magic]]al [[tattoo]]s depicting these plants.
